alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 6:21AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Dubois, central Crawford and northern Perry Counties through 700 AM EDT/600 AM CDT/... At 620 AM EDT/520 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 9 miles northeast of Santa Claus, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Crawford, northern Perry and southeastern Dubois Counties, including the following locations... Ranger, Terry, West Fork, Taswell, Mentor, Birdseye, Sulphur, Eckerty, Uniontown and Doolittle Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
